ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A barring_hole is a type of
that implements the ARM concepts of . A barring_hole represents a hole in a panel part where the punched material is partially bended in the punch direction.

The barring_hole shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'hole profile' and a
of 'closed profile occurrence'. This
shall be the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' and a
that references a , , , or .

The barring_hole shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'barring profile' and a
of 'closed profile occurrence'. This
shall be the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage'.

The barring_hole shall contain exactly one implicit representation of type . This implicit representation of the barring_hole shall contain between one and two
in its set of .

The implicit representation of a barring_hole shall contain only representation_items with a
of either 'orientation' or 'base radius'.

The implicit representation of a barring_hole shall contain exactly one
that has a
of 'base radius' and is of type
and .
The barring profile shall lie in the same plane as the hole profile.
The barring profile shall lie completely inside the hole profile.

A bead is a type of
that implements the ARM concepts of . A bead is applicable to panel parts that is used to increase the stiffness of the part.
The bead shall contain at most one implicit representation of type . If present, this implicit representation of the bead shall contain at most two representation_items in its set of .

The implicit representation of a bead shall only contain representation_items in its set of
that have a
of either 'orientation' or 'base radius'

The implicit representation of the bead shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'base radius'.

The bead shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'sweep path' and a
of 'path feature component occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'path feature component usage' in which the
is a .

The bead shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'bead profile' and a
of 'open profile occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' in which the
is an , a , a , a , a , or a .

The bead shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'end condition' and a
of 'bead end occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'bead end usage' and a
of 'starting' in which the
is a .

The bead shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'end condition' and a
of 'bead end occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'bead end usage' and a
of 'ending' in which the
is a .

A bead_end is a type of
that implements the ARM concepts of , ,
and . A bead_end is the representation of the end condition for a bead.
The bead_end shall be an aspect of the shape of a .

The
for the bead_end shall be either 'linear', 'open', or 'radiused'.
A bead_end has an implicit representation if and only if it has a description of 'linear'.

If the
of the bead_end is 'linear', its implicit representation shall contain exactly two representation_items in its set of .

If the
of the bead_end is 'linear', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the bead_end shall be of type
and
with a
of 'end length'.

If the
of the bead_end is 'linear', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the bead_end shall be of type
with a
of 'end shape' and a
of either 'straight' or 'tapered'.

The bead_end shall be the
in exactly one
with a
of 'bead end usage' and a
of either 'starting' or 'ending' in which the
is a
of a
with a
of 'end condition' and a
of 'bead end occurrence'.

A directed_angle is a type of
that implements the ARM concepts of . A directed_angle specifies an angle value and the element from which the angle is measured.
The directed_angle shall be an aspect of the shape of a .
The directed_angle shall have exactly one implicit representation defined by a .

The
that represents the shape of the directed_angle shall contain exactly one
in its set of .

The
of the directed_angle shall be either 'punch direction', 'profile normal', or 'surface normal'.

The implicit representation of the directed_angle shall have exactly one
in its set of . This
shall be of type
and
and shall have a
of 'angle'.

A feature_in_panel is a type of applicable to panel parts, that implements the ARM concepts of . A feature_in_panel consists of a ruled surface between two closed profiles one of which lies on the panel.

The feature_in_panel shall have a
of either 'pocket', 'boss', or 'stairstep'.
The implicit representation of the feature_in_panel shall contain two or three representation_items in its set of .

The implicit representation of the feature_in_panel shall contain only representation_items with a
of 'orientation', 'base radius', or 'target radius'.

The implicit representation of a feature_in_panel shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'base radius'.

The implicit representation of a feature_in_panel shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'target radius'.

The feature_in_panel shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'base boundary' and a
of either 'directed angle occurrence' or 'closed profile occurrence'.

The feature_in_panel shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'target boundary' and a
of either 'directed angle occurrence' or 'closed profile occurrence'.

The feature_in_panel shall be the basis shape for at most one
with a
of 'directed angle occurrence'.

Each
of a feature_in_panel with a
of 'directed angle occurrence' shall be the
in exactly one
with a
of 'directed angle usage' in which the
is a .

Each
of a feature_in_panel with a
of 'closed profile occurrence' shall be the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' and a
that references a , , , or .

The feature_in_panel shall have at most one . If present, this
shall have a
of 'target face'.

Each feature_in_panel that is the basis shape for a
with a
of 'target boundary' and a
of 'directed angle occurrence' shall have a .

A hole_in_panel is a type of applicable to panel parts, that implements the ARM concepts of . A hole_in_panel is an opening in a panel bounded by a closed profile that is created by a stamping process.

The hole_in_panel shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'hole profile' and a
of 'closed profile occurrence'. This
shall be the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' and a
that references a , , , or .

If an implicit representation of the hole_in_panel is present, it shall contain at most one
in its set of .

A joggle is a type of
applicable to panel parts, that implements the ARM concepts of . A joggle is a change in elevation of a face along a rim designed to accommodate either clearance for the insertion of another part or a contact point for attachment of another part.
The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain between five and ten representation_items in its set of .

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain only representation_items with a
of 'orientation', 'base radius 1', 'base radius 2', 'direction angle 1', 'direction angle 2', 'height', 'slope angle 1', 'slope angle 2', 'top radius 1', or 'top radius 2'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'direction angle 1'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'direction angle 2'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'height'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'slope angle 1'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'slope angle 2'.

The joggle shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'defining path' and a
of 'path feature component occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'path feature component usage' in which the
is a
with a
of 'linear'.

The joggle shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'termination' and a
of 'joggle termination occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'joggle termination usage' in which the
is a .

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'base radius 1'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'base radius 2'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'top radius 1'.

The implicit representation of a joggle shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'top radius 2'.

A joggle_termination is a type of
that implements the ARM concepts of ,
and . A joggle_termination is the representation of the end condition of a .
The joggle_termination shall be an aspect of the shape of a .

The
for the joggle_termination shall be either 'value termination' or 'face termination'.

A joggle_termination has an implicit representation if and only if it has a
of 'value termination'.

If the
of the joggle_termination is 'value termination', its implicit representation shall contain exactly two representation_items in its set of .

If the
of the joggle_termination is 'value termination', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the joggle_termination shall be of type
and
with a
of 'depth'.

If the of the joggle_termination is 'value termination', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the joggle_termination shall be of type
and
with a
of 'angle'.

The joggle_termination shall be the
in exactly one
with a
of 'joggle termination usage' in which the
is a
of a
with a
of 'termination' and a
of 'joggle termination occurrence'.

A locator is a type of
applicable to panel parts, that implements the ARM concepts of . A locator is a conical impression used to locate the panel in the tooling.
The implicit representation of the locator shall contain between two and five representation_items in its set of .

The implicit representation of the locator shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'diameter'.

The implicit representation of the locator shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'tip radius'.

The implicit representation of the locator shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'tip angle'.

The implicit representation of the locator shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'base radius'.
